THIS DIRECT IMPLEMENTATION TRIBAL COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT (DITCA) WILL GENERATE AN INVENTORY OF FACILITIES THROUGH SITE VISITS AND INSPECTIONS, AS WELL AS DETERMINE IF A CLASS V WELL IS PRESENT THAT MAY BE REGULATED UNDER 40 CFR PART 144 (UNDERGROUND INJECT CONTROL (UIC) REGULATIONS) AND ARE LOCATED IN INDIAN COUNTRY IN THE STATE OF MICHIGAN. DESCRIPTION:THE YAKAMA NATION WILL CONTINUE TO DEVELOP THEIR AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT CAPABILITIES AND PROGRAM THROUGH OUTREACH, EDUCATION, AND COMMUNICATION, IMPLEMENTATION OF THE FEDERAL AIR RULES FOR RESERVATIONS, IMPLEMENTATION OF A SMOKE MANAGEMENT PLAN, AIR QUALITY MONITORING, AND CONDUCTING OTHER SPECIAL PROJECTS TO IMPROVE AIR QUALITY. IMPLEMENTATION OF THESE ACTIVITIES WILL BENEFIT AND PROTECT PUBLIC HEALTH AND AIR QUALITY ON THE YAKAMA RESERVATION. ACTIVITIES:YAKAMA NATION'S ACTIVITIES WILL FOCUS ON CONTROLLING POLLUTION SOURCES ON THE RESERVATION, BUILDING TRIBAL CAPACITY, AND WORKING TO REDUCE AIR POLLUTION IN THE REGIONAL AIRSHED. SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES INCLUDE 1) BUILDING THE AIR MONITORING PROGRAM WITH THE INSTALLATION OF A NEW MONITOR FOR PM2.5 AND PM2.5 AIR SENSORS 2) FARR SUPPORT WITH OUTREACH TO AND COMMUNICATION WITH FARR SOURCES 3) FARR COMPLIANCE ASSURANCE, COMPLAINT RESPONSE, SOURCE REGISTRATION AND OTHER CAA IMPLEMENTATION ACTIVITIES UNDER THE GUIDANCE OF EPA 4) SMOKE MANAGEMENT PLAN IMPLEMENTATION AND 4) SPECIAL PROJECTS FOCUSED ON CLIMATE CHANGE RESEARCH. SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:KEY ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE REPORTS ON AIR MONITORING WORK AND DATA AND OTHER AIR QUALITY PROJECT WORK, COMPLETION OF THE FARR DELEGATION FOR OPEN BURNING, AND INCREASED TRIBAL AIR PROGRAM CAPACITY. THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THESE ACTIVITIES WILL BENEFIT AND PROTECT PUBLIC HEALTH AND AIR QUALITY ON THE RESERVATION.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO THE RECIPIENT FOR THE IMPLEMENTATION OF ITS PROGRAM TO ENSURE THAT UNDERGROUND SOURCES OF DRINKING WATER ARE PROTECTED FROM ENDANGERING INJECTION ACTIVITIES. THE MAJOR COMPONENTS OF THE PROGRAM INCLUDE: THE DEVELOPMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF INVENTORIES OF INJECTION SYSTEMS; THE DEVELOPMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF DATABASES HOUSING COMPLIANCE INFORMATION ON UNDERGROUND INJECTION WELL ACTIVITIES; THE IMPLEMENTATION OF PERMITTING ACTIVITIES; AND THE IMPLEMENTATION OF ENFORCEMENT PROGRAMS TO ENSURE THAT UNDERGROUND SOURCES OF DRINKING WATER ARE PROTECTED FROM UNDERGROUND INJECTION ACTIVITIESACTIVITIES:THE OSAGE NATION ESTABLISHED THE OSAGE NATION UNDERGROUND INJECTION CONTROL (UIC) PROGRAM IN 1980 AND HAS CONTINUED THE PROGRAM EACH YEAR THEREAFTER. THE UIC PROGRAM NOW FALLS UNDER THE OVERALL OBJECTIVES OF THE OSAGE NATION DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES (DNR), WHICH WAS ESTABLISHED IN 2001. PRESENTLY, APPROXIMATELY 2400 CLASS II INJECTION WELLS ARE BEING MONITORED ON THE RESERVATION. THE PROGRAM COMMITMENTS EACH YEAR HAVE INCLUDED CONDUCTING WELL INSPECTIONS; WITNESSING MECHANICAL INTEGRITY TESTS (MITS); INITIATING COMPLIANCE AND ENFORCEMENT ACTIVITIES; INVESTIGATING CITIZENS' COMPLAINTS; CONDUCTING FIELD AND OFFICE PERMITTING ACTIVITIES; MANAGING ALL DATA RELATED TO THE OSAGE NATION UIC PROGRAM; AND MANAGING ALL ASPECTS OF THE PROGRAM.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:CONDUCT 1700 INSPECTIONS OF CLASS II INJECTIONS WELLS EACH YEAR. INSPECTIONS WILL BE CONDUCTED ON ALL WELLS TESTED FOR MECHANICAL INTEGRITY (MITS) AND WILL BE CONDUCTED ON THE DAY OF THE TEST. THESE INSPECTIONS WILL BE INCLUDED IN THE 1700-WELL COMMITMENT. INSPECTIONS WILL BE PRIORITIZED BASED ON FACTORS MUTUALLY AGREED UPON BY THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA) AND THE OSAGE NATION. THE EPA WILL PROVIDE A LIST OF PRIMARY INSPECTIONS WHICH GENERALLY ARE THOSE WELLS THAT HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED WITH COMPLIANCE PROBLEMS OR WELLS THAT HAVE NOT BEEN INSPECTED IN TWO (2) YEARS OR MORE. THESE INSPECTIONS WILL BE GIVEN HIGHEST PRIORITY. THE PRIMARY LIST WILL INCLUDE WELLS SCHEDULED FOR INSPECTIONS DUE TO ENFORCEMENT ACTIONS, VIOLATIONS DISCOVERED ON PRIOR INSPECTIONS, AND SPECIAL REQUESTS BY THE EPA. THE PRIMARY LIST WILL BE UPDATED EVERY MONTH AND WILL INCLUDE ALL INSPECTIONS KNOWN TO BE DUE FOR INSPECTION WITHIN THE NEXT 3 MONTHS. 50% OF THE WELLS ON THE PRIMARY LIST WILL BE INSPECTED DURING THE SCHEDULED MONTH FOR THE INSPECTIONS. COLLECTION OF GLOBAL POSITIONING SYSTEM (GPS) LOCATION DATA ON ALL NEW WELLS AND THOSE WELLS THAT DO NOT HAVE GPS DATA WILL BE INCLUDED IN THE INSPECTIONS. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES ARE THE OSAGE NATION, OK INDIAN TRIBE.

THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE EPA AND THE NEZ PERCE TRIBE ENABLES THE TRIBES AIR PROGRAM TO CARRY OUT DIRECT IMPLEMENTATION OF PORTIONS OF THE CLEAN AIR ACT AND THE FEDERAL AIR RULES FOR RESERVATIONS THROUGH BURN BANS, AGRICULTURAL, FORESTRY AND OPEN BURNING PERMIT PROGRAMS, AND OTHER ACTIVITIES. THE GOAL OF THE FARR DITCA IS TO WORK WITH EPA TO SUCCESSFULLY IMPLEMENT THE DELEGATION AGREEMENT AND THE INSPECTOR CREDENTIALS AGREEMENT ON THE NEZ PERCE RESERVATION. A SECOND GOAL OF THE DITCA IS TO COORDINATE ON-RESERVATION SMOKE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM (SMP) AND FARR ACTIVITIES WITH EPA, IDEQ, NEZ PERCE TRIBE FORESTRY AND FIRE DEPARTMENTS, THE IDAHO DEPARTMENT OF LANDS (IDL), AND OTHER AGENCIES TO PROVIDE A RELATIVELY SEAMLESS SMP FOR CROP RESIDUE, FORESTRY, AND OPEN BURNING IN THE CLEARWATER AIRSHED THAT PROTECTS HUMAN HEALTH AND WELFARE WHILE RETAINING BURNING AS A MANAGEMENT TOOL. THE PRIMARY GOAL FOR AN ENVIRONMENTAL OUTCOME OF THE DITCA IS TO PROTECT HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT ON NEZ PERCE RESERVATION AND TRIBAL COMMUNITY BY REDUCING IMPACTS OF SMOKE AND OTHER POLLUTANTS REGULATED UNDER THE CLEAN AIR ACT AND THE FARR.

THIS PROJECT'S ACTIVITIES: (1) INVOLVE THE TRIBAL STAFF CONTINUING TO PROVIDE COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE (AS NEEDED) TO REGULATED UST FACILITIES; (2) CONTINUE THE REQUIRED TRAINING FOR RCRA SUBTITLE I INSPECTORS TO KEEP FEDERAL INSPECTOR CREDENTIALS; (3) CONDUCT COMPLIANCE INSPECTIONS WITHIN THE PARTICIPATING RESERVATIONS; AND (4) DEVELOP THE NECESSARY PARTNERSHIP/COMMUNICATION TO COORDINATE INSPECTIONS WITH EPA. ACTIVITIES:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES SUPPORT FOR MILLE LACS TO CONDUCT COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE WALKTHROUGHS THAT ARE COMPRISED OF THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: REVIEW OF PREVIOUS WALKTHROUGH/INSPECTIONS WITH FACILITY OWNER/OPERATOR; REVIEW OF THE FACILITY'S CURRENT COMPLIANCE WITH THE FEDERAL UST REGULATIONS (EPA REGION 5'S UST INSPECTION SOP
WILL BE USED AS A GUIDE); DISCUSSION OF ANY ISSUES FOUND DURING THE WALKTHROUGH WITH THE OWNER/OPERATOR; SUPPORTIVE GUIDANCE ON HOW TO CORRECT ANY ISSUES FOUND DURING
THE VISIT. 
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:MILLE LACS BAND OF OJIBWE STRIVES TO COMPLETE 30 COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE WALK THROUGHS PER YEAR. THESE INSPECTIONS ARE DESIGNED TO CONNECT LOCAL FACILITIES TO A TRIBAL UST EXPERT WHO UNDERSTANDS BOTH THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY AND FEDERAL REQUIREMENTS. THE TRIBAL UST PROGRAM MANAGEMENT TEAM WILL INCREASE COMMUNITY WIDE KNOWLEDGE OF UST REGULATIONS, CONTINUE TO IMPROVE THE SOC RATE (INCREASE BY 0.5% EACH YEAR), AND IMPROVE U.S. EPA INSPECTOR ABILITY TO CONDUCT ROUTINE INSPECTIONS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS DIRECT IMPLEMENTATION TRIBAL COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT (DITCA) INCLUDES PROCURING A CONTRACTOR TO DEVELOP SITE AND DESIGN PLANS AND TO INSTALL A SEPTIC TANK AND DRAIN FIELDS.  THE PLANS WILL INCLUDE BLUEPRINTS OF FLOOR PLANS, A BIRDS EYE VIEW OF THE SEPTIC TANK, A DRAIN FIELD AND ITS RELATION TO POLE BARN BUILDING ON SITE.  ACTIVITIES:THIS PROJECT CONSISTS OF PROCURING A CONTRACTOR TO DEVELOP SITE AND DESIGN PLANS, AS WELL AS INSTALLING A SEPTIC TANK AND DRAIN FIELDS.  THE PLANS WILL INCLUDE BLUEPRINTS OF FLOOR PLANS, A BIRDS EYE VIEW OF THE SEPTIC TANK, A DRAIN FIELD AND ITS RELATION TO POLE BARN BUILDING ON SITE.  THE CONTRACTOR WILL ALSO LOCATE UNDERGROUND WATER LINES AND TIE THEM INTO EXISTING WATER LINES, AS WELL AS COMPLETE THE ACTIVITIES NECESSARY TO CREATE THE DRAIN FIELD AND SEPTIC TANK.  THE CONTRACTOR WILL ALSO ENSURE THAT EVERYTHING IS READY FOR CONNECTION TO THE BUILDING FACILITY ONCE IT IS CONSTRUCTED.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE RECIPIENT WILL PROVIDE SEMI-ANNUAL REPORTS AND A FINAL REPORT. THE FINAL REPORT WOULD BE MORE DETAILED AND INCLUDE PHOTOS THAT CLEARLY SHOW ANY SUBSURFACE SYSTEM INSTALLATIONS, AS WELL AS FINISHED INSTALLATION WORK.  BY UPGRADING THE CURRENT INJECTION SYSTEM, THE ENVIRONMENTAL OUTCOME IS THE PROTECTION OF AN UNDERGROUND SOURCE OF DRINKING WATER (USDW) WHICH IS IN AGREEMENT WITH THE UIC MISSION.

THIS DITCA WILL GENERATE AN INVENTORY OF FACILITIES THAT MAY BE REGULATED UNDER 40 CFR PART 144 (UIC REGULATIONS) AND ARE LOCATED ON THE WHITE EARTH RESERVATION. THE INVENTORY WILL CONSIST OF A COMPLETED SPREADSHEET LISTING THE FACILITIES IDENTIFIED.  FACILITIES THAT COULD GENERALLY POSE THE GREATEST THREAT TO GROUNDWATER WOULD BE IDENTIFIED FIRST, FOLLOWED BY THE REMAINING REGULATED FACILITIES.  A MAP WILL BE PROVIDED WITH SUFFICIENT DETAIL TO LOCATE EACH OF THE IDENTIFIED FACILITIES.  THE INVENTORY INFORMATION WILL BE ENTERED BY U.S. EPA INTO A CLASS V INVENTORY REVIEW DATABASE AND WILL BE USED FOR OUTREACH/COMPLIANCE ASSURANCE ACTIVITIES AND PLANNING FOLLOW-UP INSPECTIONS BY A CREDENTIALED UIC INSPECTOR.
